title: Myra Moller
text:
Myra Timena Moller (born 1984) is an elite cyclist born in New Zealand. She competes in both mountain biking and road cycling events. Myra is the niece of Olympic marathon bronze medallist, <a href="Lorraine%20Moller">Lorraine Moller</a>, and the daughter of Teniinii and Gary Moller. Myra discovered Mountain Biking at 13. She entered the World Cup Open (Pro Elite grade) aged 17. She represented <a href="New%20Zealand">New Zealand</a> in the Elite Women's Duathlon World Championships in 2005. In 2006, she competed at the <a href="Commonwealth%20Games">Commonwealth Games</a>, held in <a href="Melbourne">Melbourne</a>, <a href="Australia">Australia</a>. She was the first cyclist to represent the <a href="Cook%20Islands">Cook Islands</a> at the <a href="Commonwealth%20Games">Commonwealth Games</a>. In 2008,2009, she competed in the Australian Open Road Championships Road Race.
Palmarès.

2005
2006
